title: OPEC+ Deal Will Bring Some Sort of Normality By End of Year: NNPC’s Kyari
text: Mallam Mele Kolo Kyari, managing director at Nigerian National Petroleum Corp. Group, says the OPEC+ production cut deal was necessary to re-balance the oil market and move Brent prices towards $42 to $45 a barrel by the end of the year. The oil executive also insists his company will not cut jobs this year. He speaks exclusively to Bloomberg’s Manus Cranny.

title: Asian shares creep higher as markets wait for Fed
text: Asian stock markets eked out a 10th consecutive session of gains on Wednesday, but momentum ebbed as doubts about the global recovery from the pandemic returned ahead of the U.S. Federal Reserve meeting.

title: Oil drops after U.S. inventory build renews oversupply concerns
text: Oil prices fell on Wednesday as an industry report showed a rise in crude and fuel inventories in the United States, renewing concerns about oversupply and slumping fuel demand in the world's largest crude consumer.

title: DoubleLine's Gundlach bearish on U.S. dollar, says stocks 'lofty'
text: The U.S. dollar is unlikely to make significant moves higher in the near term because of the ballooning budget deficit, Jeffrey Gundlach, the billionaire chief executive of DoubleLine Capital, said on a webcast presentation on Tuesday.

title: Dollar nurses losses amid caution ahead of Fed
text: The dollar nursed losses against most currencies on Wednesday amid some speculation the U.S. Federal Reserve could take steps to curb a recent rise in bond yields at its policy meeting.

title: Chinese companies put U.S. listing plans on ice as tensions mount
text: Chinese companies are putting off plans for U.S. listings as tensions between the world's top two economies rise, lawyers, bankers, accountants and regulators involved in what has been a major capital-raising route told Reuters.

title: Trump wants to delist Chinese companies from U.S. exchanges. That could hurt Wall Street
text: A new bill that targets Chinese companies listed on U.S. exchanges could not only "backfire" on American investors, and Wall Street could oppose it, a Harvard professor told CNBC on Tuesday.

title: Treasury yield comeback is real, and the 10-year could hit 1.5% within months, Wells Fargo says
text: Wells Fargo Securities' Michael Schumacher is getting more confident about the economic recovery.

title: Some Stock Market Realities
text: Add another big-name hedge fund manager to the list of those calling for a rocky market. Should you follow their warnings or stay invested?

title: Dow futures climb ahead of Fed update after blue-chip index snaps 6-day win streak, while Nasdaq marks fresh record
text: U.S. stock-index futures Tuesday evening were trading slightly higher ahead of a key policy update from the Federal Reserve on Wednesday.

title: Marathon CEO Expects Bankruptcy Surge, Favors Hotels Over Retail
text: Marathon Asset Management Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Bruce Richards talks with Bloomberg's Vonnie Quinn.

title: Find Strong-Buy Stocks Near Highs Amid Coronavirus Reopening Rally
text: Find Strong-Buy Stocks Near Highs Amid Coronavirus Reopening Rally

title: Stock futures flat as investors await Fed's comments on the economy
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average and S&P 500 were under pressure on Tuesday as stocks benefiting from the economic reopening fell broadly.

title: Retail investors buying beaten-up stocks make for some bizarre trading days
text: Interest in stay-at-home stocks have reached new heights in the last few days, fueled in part by hopes for a dramatic rebound in the economy.

title: Nasdaq Notches Higher, Dow & S&P 500 Take a Powder
text: The Nasdaq once again finished higher, albeit modestly: +29 points, or +0.29%. This marks the 18th record close for the S&P index in the year 2020 alone.

title: Loomis Sayles' Fuss on Negative Yields, Corporate Credit
text: Loomis Sayles & Co. Vice Chairman Dan Fuss says the Federal Reserve has been clear they don't want negative yields and he sees rates staying low for some time. He speaks with Bloomberg's Caroline Hyde and Romaine Bostick on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close."

title: Behavioral Investing Mistakes Abound This Year
text: Behavioral finance has gained a considerable amount of popularity over the past few years as it pertains to investing. Among other things, it highlights how humans appear to be hardwired to make certain systematic mistakes despite our best efforts.

title: Has the market run too far too fast?
text: Opimas CEO Octavio Marenzi joins Yahoo Finance’s Heidi Chung to discuss his outlook on the latest market volatility.

title: What's next from the Fed will help decide the course for markets
text: How much the Fed will reveal about its future intentions and what it says about its view of the economy will be key for markets.

title: Nasdaq releases its top 25 ETFs for the last week and month — here's what's working
text: The Nasdaq's ranking takes into consideration high potential for return, trading volume, outstanding shares and asset growth, its chief economist says.

title: API data show weekly U.S. crude supplies up by more than 8 million barrels, sources say
text: The American Petroleum Institute reported late Tuesday that U.S. crude supplies rose by 8.4 million barrels for the week ended June 5, according to sources.

title: S&P 500 rally hits pause – Cramer and two others on what's next
text: The S&P 500 fell on Tuesday following the market's recent rally on reopening plans. Three experts weigh in on what could come next.

title: Boom Times For Tech Stocks Sends Nasdaq Past 10,000-Point Mark
text: The Nasdaq cracked the 10,000-point mark for the first time Tuesday before cooling off to close at 9,953.75, a gain of 29.1 points for the day. Over the past year, the tech-heavy index has climbed 33%, far outpacing economic growth and downright contradicting the bleak picture of unemployment and collapse over the past three months.

title: US Indexes End Mostly Lower Tuesday (June 9)
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 27,272.30 on Tuesday with a loss of 300.14 points or -1.09%.

title: Stocks trend lower as investors step back, safe-havens rally
text: A recent run of optimism in markets hit the brakes on Tuesday as investors mostly pulled back from stocks, though the Nasdaq extended its record run to a new high, while the safe-haven yen, Swiss franc and gold rallied.

title: Nancy Tengler on tech stocks
text: Nancy Tengler, Laffer Tengler Investments CIO, joins "Closing Bell" to talk about the state of the markets and tech stocks.

title: Stock Market Today: Rally Slows, But Nasdaq Resets the Ceiling Again
text: Nasdaq advances, but Dow and S&P 500 take small steps back

title: FOMC preview: Fed to focus on yield curve as short-term interest rates near zero
text: With short-term interest rates already near-zero, the Federal Reserve will shift its focus to pinning down longer-term interest rates in its policy-setting meeting this week.

title: Here's what happened to the stock market on Tuesday (June 9)
text: Stocks were mostly under pressure as traders took profits from the so-called reopening trade, which has led the market's recently sharp gains.

title: Stock-market rally stalls even as Nasdaq closes at record
text: U.S. stocks ended mostly lower on Tuesday as Wall Street took a breather from its relentless gains in the past few weeks.

title: Nasdaq tops 10,000 for the first time ever
text: Wall Street's love affair with technology stocks shows no sign of stopping.

title: Investors are putting their money in opportunity zones—here's where it's all going
text: CNBC's Robert Frank reports on the opportunity zones investors are putting their money and if there is accountability from the government.

title: Why The Federal Reserve May Let Down The Dow Jones Tomorrow
text: Forceful Federal Reserve policy this year helped revive the Dow Jones. But is the Fed playing it too cool now as interest rates rise?

title: Breaking down the challenges with the Federal Reserve and the Main Street Lending program
text: J O Hambro Senior Fund Manager & Head of Credit Lale Topcuoglu joins Yahoo Finance’s On The Move panel to discuss the Fed’s expansion of its Main Street Lending program.

title: The Many Economic Effects Of The Coronavirus
text: The global spread of the coronavirus in 2020 prompted a record plunge in the U.S.

title: U.S. May Be Facing Shortest Recession of All Time, Yardeni Says
text: Ed Yardeni, president of Yardeni Research, says the markets had a "panic attack" during the Covid-19 pandemic and stocks may be in a melt-up phase.

title: Gold Futures Reverse Higher Off Key Price Support
text: August Gold Futures Trading Chart As I pointed out yesterday, we are long Gold futures off the latest test of make-or-break price support.

title: Dollar Took Meaningful Hit From Bottoming of Global Growth: Nordvig
text: “We definitely have a bearish bias” for the U.S. dollar, says Jens Nordvig, founder and chief executive officer at Exante Data. He speaks with Bloomberg’s Tom Keene on “Bloomberg Surveillance.”

title: If we don't have a major upturn in oil prices soon...we are going to see bankruptcies: Dan Eberhart
text: Canary LLC CEO & 'The Switch' Author Dan Eberhart joins Yahoo Finance’s Zack Guzman to discuss the latest outlook for oil and energy amid fuel demand concerns.

title: U.S. oil prices give up earlier losses to finish higher
text: Oil futures gave up earlier losses on Tuesday to finish higher. Expectations that major Gulf producers won't extend voluntary output cuts beyond this month, as well as the potential for a climb in U.S.

title: Insana: The Fed shouldn't try to 'control' interest rates
text: While it's generally the Fed's job to attempt to assert control over every aspect of credit market behavior, it may want to stop short of taking one more step that has come up as a real possibility: capping the yield curve.

title: Financial Stocks Should Not Be Getting Beat Up, Says JPM's Manley
text: Jack Manley of JPMorgan Asset Management, sees a recovery ahead for financial stocks. He also talks about retail stocks and the oil market. He appears on "Bloomberg The Open."

title: Investors brace for market swings as Trump slips in election polls
text: The U.S. presidential election is re-emerging as a potential risk to markets after a shift in polls that has seen President Donald Trump lose ground to Democrat Joe Biden.

title: Stocks mixed as investors step back from highs
text: A recent run of optimism in markets hit the brakes on Tuesday, as investors pulled back from major stock indices and turned their attention to safe-haven assets like gold.

title: Gold futures settle higher, buoyed by slight weakness in U.S. equities a day ahead of the Fed's policy statement
text: Gold futures settled higher Tuesday, getting a lift as the Dow pulled back a bit a day ahead of the Federal Reserve's monetary policy statement.

title: Strategist lays out why gold is an effective hedge against inflation
text: Gold prices rose on Tuesday amid the coronavirus pandemic. George Milling-Stanley, State Street Global Advisors Chief Gold Strategist joins Yahoo Finance’s On The Move to discuss.

title: Explainer: What to look for in the Fed's U.S. economic outlook
text: U.S. Federal Reserve policymakers on Wednesday will publish their first economic projections since the coronavirus pandemic set off a recession in February, estimates expected to signal a collapse in output this year and near-zero interest rates for the next few years.

title: Oil is up $80 in seven weeks. The remarkable recovery could be too good to be true
text: The oil market has rapidly recovered from its darkest day ever.

title: Stocks tumble as coronavirus recovery rally takes a hit
text: US stocks tumbled on Tuesday after a six-day rally that had briefly left the S&P 500 index in positive territory for the year. The Dow Jones industrial average dropped as much as 421.38, or 1.5 percent, to 27,151.06 by midday, as doubts resurfaced about the US economy’s ability to recover from the coronavirus crisis.

title: Market still has upside, says investor
text: CNBC's "Halftime Report" team discusses their stock picks amid the day's market action.
